title: Tell us about that one Toxic player.

replies.body:
Feel free to talk about any experiences here, but **don't name any summoner names**. 

Remember that _"Naming and Shaming"_ is against the [board rules](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/BjArMH2B-boards-universal-rules) and can land you a temporary ban from the boards.
quick return the name they took away
Why are we unable to name and shame? I think it should be allowed since these players need to be stopped.

> [{quoted}](name=Jesus had GA,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=PAE2g7zi,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2016-12-14T05:33:46.210+0000)
>
> Why are we unable to name and shame? I think it should be allowed since these players need to be stopped.

That's like asking why we aren't aloud to spread malicious false rumors. Because it destroys someone's reputation. If you want them to be stopped REPORT THEM, three clicks after the game and it goes to the system. Not rocket science.

Reporting does absolutely nothing to change a huge percent of people. Ive reported people only to see them in future games flaming and carrying on. On the oce server ive never heard of anyone getting banned for toxic behavior. Ive only seen chat restrictions. And they use their limited messages to flame anyway.

The rule is mainly there for two reasons:

+ **To prevent "witch hunts" **

 'Witch hunts' are situations where someone publicly shames a player, and then everyone gets together to harass him and ruin his games. Essentially players try to take punishment into their own hands, when they don't have a complete view of all the evidence like Riot does.

 It's gets pretty ugly when players go too far on a toxic player, but it's even worse when someone who isn't even guilty gets caught up the mess.


+ **To stop rewarding trolls**

 When Riot released [this](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/8a75KeUR-the-indefinite-banning-of-tyler1), I thought they made a really stupid and hypocritical decision. And it looks like I was right. **Tyler1** just got even more popular and the "most toxic player NA" became part of his brand. 

 I'd hate for trolls to see the OCE boards as a place where they can check to see how many people they've managed to trigger. Just excluding names from posts can pretty much shutdown anything like this entirely.

I've got to admit though, the way you want to name and shame is actually pretty cool. It's more like a therapy session vibe, rather than the things I outlined above. 

Unfortunately, if the mods gave you a free pass, it would be massively unfair on everyone else who got punished for naming and shaming. 

We really do appreciate your intentions here though ;)
